soc.message

Class SOCReportRobbery

  • java.lang.Object
    • soc.message.SOCMessage
      • soc.message.SOCReportRobbery
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, SOCMessageForGame

    public class SOCReportRobbery
extends SOCMessage
implements SOCMessageForGame
    This message from the server gives info about a robbery's perpetrator, victim, and what was stolen. Its audience can be the perpetrator or victim (specifics about what was stolen), or the rest of the game (unknown resource), or announced to the entire game (cloth in Cloth Trade scenario).

    Clients older than v2.4.50 (MIN_VERSION) are instead sent a sequence of SOCPlayerElement and SOCGameServerText messages.

    Scenarios and Expansions:

    Along with robbery in the standard rules, this message is used for:
    • Cloth Trade scenario (SC_CLVI):
      Players may rob cloth from opponents. Announced with peType = SOCPlayerElement.PEType.SCENARIO_CLOTH_COUNT
    • Pirate Islands scenario (SC_PIRI):
      Announces the results of a pirate fleet attack on a player.
      • perpPN = -1
      • extraValue = strength of pirate fleet
      • If player won: amount = 0, resType = SOCResourceConstants.UNKNOWN; server will also announce SOCPlayerElement(SOCPlayerElement.PEType.NUM_PICK_GOLD_HEX_RESOURCES) and send player a SOCSimpleRequest(PROMPT_PICK_RESOURCES)
      • If tied: amount = 0, resType = 0.
        This is optional; so far no released server version reports ties, since nothing is gained or lost.
      • If player lost: amount = number of resources lost, resType = SOCResourceConstants.UNKNOWN; server will also send to player with resSet or resType = specific resources lost
      See also SOCSimpleAction(SC_PIRI_FORT_ATTACK_RESULT) used in this scenario to announce fortress attack attempt results.
    Since:
    2.4.50
    Author:
    Jeremy D Monin <jeremy@nand.net>
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      int amount
      Amount stolen if isGainLose, or perpPN's new total amount (see victimAmount).
      int extraValue
      Optional information related to the robbery, or 0; for use by scenarios/expansions.
      java.lang.String gaName
      Name of the game
      boolean isGainLose
      True if amount is gained by perpPN and lost by victimPN, false if amount and victimAmount are their new total amounts to set.
      static int MIN_VERSION
      Version number (2.4.50) where this message type was introduced.
      int perpPN
      Perpetrator player number, or -1 if none (used by SC_PIRI scenario's pirate fleet attack results, future use by other scenarios/expansions)
      SOCPlayerElement.PEType peType
      PlayerElement type such as SOCPlayerElement.PEType.SCENARIO_CLOTH_COUNT, or null if what's being stolen is a resSet or a single resource type like sheep (use resType instead).
      SOCResourceSet resSet
      Resource set being stolen, or null if what's being stolen is a single resource type like sheep or unknown (use resType instead) or a peType.

      Resource type being stolen, like SOCResourceConstants.SHEEP or SOCResourceConstants.UNKNOWN.

      victimPN's new total amount if not isGainLose (see amount); unsent (0) if isGainLose.

      Victim player number, or -1 if none (for future use by scenarios/expansions)

    • Field Detail

      • MIN_VERSION

        public static final int MIN_VERSION
        Version number (2.4.50) where this message type was introduced.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • gaName

        public final java.lang.String gaName
        Name of the game

      • victimPN

        public final int victimPN
        Victim player number, or -1 if none (for future use by scenarios/expansions)

      • perpPN

        public final int perpPN
        Perpetrator player number, or -1 if none (used by SC_PIRI scenario's pirate fleet attack results, future use by other scenarios/expansions)

      • resType

        public final int resType
        Resource type being stolen, like SOCResourceConstants.SHEEP or SOCResourceConstants.UNKNOWN. Ignored if resSet != null or peType != null.

      • resSet

        public final SOCResourceSet resSet
        Resource set being stolen, or null if what's being stolen is a single resource type like sheep or unknown (use resType instead) or a peType. Should not be empty or contain SOCResourceConstants.UNKNOWN resources.

      • peType

        public final SOCPlayerElement.PEType peType
        PlayerElement type such as SOCPlayerElement.PEType.SCENARIO_CLOTH_COUNT, or null if what's being stolen is a resSet or a single resource type like sheep (use resType instead).

      • isGainLose

        public final boolean isGainLose
        True if amount is gained by perpPN and lost by victimPN, false if amount and victimAmount are their new total amounts to set.

        Always true if resSet != null, which doesn't use amount and victimAmount fields.

      • amount

        public final int amount
        Amount stolen if isGainLose, or perpPN's new total amount (see victimAmount). Ignored if resSet != null.

      • victimAmount

        public final int victimAmount
        victimPN's new total amount if not isGainLose (see amount); unsent (0) if isGainLose. Ignored if resSet != null.

      • extraValue

        public final int extraValue
        Optional information related to the robbery, or 0; for use by scenarios/expansions. Used in scenario SC_PIRI to send the pirate fleet strength when they attack (see class javadoc).

    • Constructor Detail

      • SOCReportRobbery

        public SOCReportRobbery(java.lang.String gaName,
                        int perpPN,
                        int victimPN,
                        int resType,
                        boolean isGainLose,
                        int amount,
                        int victimAmount,
                        int extraValue)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Create a SOCReportRobbery message about one resource type (not a resource set, or cloth or some other SOCPlayerElement.PEType).
        Parameters:
        gaName - name of the game
        perpPN - Perpetrator's player number, or -1 if none (for future use by scenarios/expansions)
        victimPN - Victim's player number, or -1 if none (for future use by scenarios/expansions)
        resType - Resource type being stolen, like SOCResourceConstants.SHEEP or SOCResourceConstants.UNKNOWN
        isGainLose - If true, the amount here is a delta Gained/Lost by players, not a total to Set
        amount - Amount being stolen if isGainLose, otherwise perpPN's new total amount
        victimAmount - victimPN's new total amount if not isGainLose, 0 otherwise
        extraValue - Optional information related to the robbery, or 0; see extraValue
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if amount, victimAmount, or resType < 0, or isGainLose but victimAmount != 0
        See Also:
        SOCReportRobbery(String, int, int, SOCResourceSet, int), #SOCReportRobbery(String, int, int, int, SOCResourceSet, PEType, boolean, int, int, int)

      • SOCReportRobbery

        public SOCReportRobbery(java.lang.String gaName,
                        int perpPN,
                        int victimPN,
                        SOCResourceSet resSet,
                        int extraValue)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Create a SOCReportRobbery message about a resource set (not one resource type, or cloth or some other SOCPlayerElement.PEType). Will set isGainLose == true.
        Parameters:
        gaName - name of the game
        perpPN - Perpetrator's player number, or -1 if none (for future use by scenarios/expansions)
        victimPN - Victim's player number, or -1 if none (for future use by scenarios/expansions)
        resSet - Resource set being stolen; not null or empty. Should not contain SOCResourceConstants.UNKNOWN, those will be ignored.
        extraValue - Optional information related to the robbery, or 0; see extraValue
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if SOCResourceSet.isEmpty()
        See Also:
        SOCReportRobbery(String, int, int, int, boolean, int, int, int), #SOCReportRobbery(String, int, int, int, SOCResourceSet, PEType, boolean, int, int, int)

                        int perpPN,
                        int victimPN,
                        SOCPlayerElement.PEType peType,
                        boolean isGainLose,
                        int amount,
                        int victimAmount,
                        int extraValue)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Create a SOCReportRobbery message about cloth or some other player element (not a resource or resource set).
        Parameters:
        gaName - name of the game
        perpPN - Perpetrator's player number, or -1 if none (for future use by scenarios/expansions)
        victimPN - Victim's player number, or -1 if none (for future use by scenarios/expansions)
        peType - the type of element, like SOCPlayerElement.PEType.SCENARIO_CLOTH_COUNT
        isGainLose - If true, the amount here is a delta Gained/Lost by players, not a total to Set
        amount - Amount being stolen if isGainLose, otherwise perpPN's new total amount
        victimAmount - victimPN's new total amount if not isGainLose, 0 otherwise
        extraValue - Optional information related to the robbery, or 0; see extraValue
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if peType null, or amount or victimAmount < 0, or isGainLose but victimAmount != 0
        See Also:
        SOCReportRobbery(String, int, int, int, boolean, int, int, int), SOCReportRobbery(String, int, int, SOCResourceSet, int)

    • Method Detail

      • getGame

        public java.lang.String getGame()
        Description copied from interface: SOCMessageForGame
        Name of game this message is for, if any. Must not be null in a message sent to the server: If message is not about per-game structures or code, use SOCMessage.GAME_NONE.

        At the server, the message treater dispatches incoming SOCMessageForGames based on their getGame():

        • null: Message is ignored
        • SOCMessage.GAME_NONE: Message is handled by SOCServer itself or SOCServerMessageHandler
        • Any other game name: Looks for a game with that name, to dispatch to the GameHandler for that game's type. If no game with that name is found, the message is ignored.
        Specified by:
        getGame in interface SOCMessageForGame
        Returns:
        the name of the game

      • getMinimumVersion

        public final int getMinimumVersion()
        Minimum version where this message type is used. Introduced in v2.4.50 (MIN_VERSION).
        Overrides:
        getMinimumVersion in class SOCMessage
        Returns:
        Version number, 2450 for JSettlers 2.4.50

      • toCmd

        public java.lang.String toCmd()
        SOCMessage.REPORTROBBERY sep gameName sep2 perpPN sep2 victimPN sep2 (('R' sep2 resType sep2 amount) or ('S' sep2 resType sep2 amount sep2 resType sep2 amount ...) or ('E' sep2 peType.getValue() sep2 amount)) sep2 (isGainLose: 'T' or 'F') [sep2 victimAmount [sep2 extraValue]]
        Specified by:
        toCmd in class SOCMessage
        Returns:
        the command string

      • parseDataStr

        public static SOCReportRobbery parseDataStr(java.lang.String cmd)

        Parameters:

      • stripAttribNames

        public static java.lang.String stripAttribNames(java.lang.String messageStrParams)
        Strip out the parameter/attribute names from toString()'s format, returning message parameters as a list for SOCMessage.parseMsgStr(String). Handles resSet= resource type amounts, undoes mapping of action constant integers -> strings ("SCENARIO_CLOTH_COUNT" etc).
        Parameters:
        messageStrParams - Params part of a message string formatted by toString(); not null
        Returns:
        Message parameters to finish parsing into a SOCMessage, or null if malformed

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Description copied from class: SOCMessage
        Simple human-readable delimited representation, used for debug purposes: SOCPutPiece:game=test5|playerNumber=3|pieceType=0|coord=40a
        Could also be used by a SOCServer.recordGameEvent(String, SOCMessage) implementation.

        Within this representation, message parameters should be in same order used by SOCMessage.toCmd() and parseDataStr(..). Should be parseable by SOCMessage.parseMsgStr(String) which calls SOCMessage.stripAttribNames(String), which your class can override if needed.

        Specified by:
        toString in class SOCMessage
        Returns:
        a human readable form of the message
        See Also:
        SOCMessage.toCmd()
